result.execSummary:
The defendant Ceafus R Chillis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$150.00 payable to the victim Orville D.  
Hearing April 30, 2015 in Br. 2.
**4/30/2015  $131.243.16 payable to Crime Victim Compensation Funds or the victim Orville D., whomever it is appropriate to go to;  $150.00 payable to victim Orville D.; $40.00 to Orville D.; and $350.00 to Orville D.
All restitution to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to civil judgment.

Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victim Orville D.

Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Complete a cognitive behavior therapy program and an anger management program.
Cooperate and participate with any other clinical programming deemed appropriate by the probation department.
Cooperate and particiapte with AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended programming.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA surcharge, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess  a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are restored.

Court ordered defendant to pay restitution as follows: 

* PAY restitution in the amount of $131,243.16 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Fund  OR  the victim, Orville D. - WHOMEVER IT IS APPROPRIATE TO GO TO. The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

* PAY restitution in the amount of $350.00 payable to the victim, Orville D.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ceafus R Chillis in court IN CUSTODY with attorney James E Goldmann.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. No changes made to the PSI.  Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 13 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 8 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit for 398 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendatn is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim, Orville D.
* Complete a cognitive behavior therapy program.
* Complete an anger management program.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with any other clinical programming deemed appropriate by the Probation Department.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the stipulated amount of $150.00 payable to the victim, Orville D.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Case adjourned to 04-30-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Restitution Hearing.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Probation Department for processing.
Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits; signed and filed.  (Exhibits 1 and 2)

AM COURT REPORTER, PHYLLIS PEOPLES.
PM COURT REPORTER, JENNIFER CARTER.

Defendant Ceafus R Chillis in court with attorney James Eric Goldmann.  Defendant Ceafus R Chillis in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury Trial continued.
Sworn and testiffied as a witness for the State:  Orville D., Lamont B., Mark C., Kimberly Y., and Lashanda W.
Court entered and received into evidence exhibit #s 1 and 2.
State rests subject to rebuttal.
Time is now 11:45 AM and Court breaks for lunch.
Jury out of box at 11:46 AM.

BACK ON THE RECORD.....
Jury in the box at 2:18 PM.
Sworn and testified as a witness for the defense:  MPD Detective Douglas Williams and MPD Detective Stella Payne.
Defense rests. 
Testimony closed.

Court takes a break.
Jury out of box at 2:48 PM.

BACK ON THE RECORD.....
Instruction conference held with the parties only.
Jury in the box at 3:40 PM.
Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:24 PM to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Cross and Urban who were duly sworn for that purpose.

BACK ON THE RECORD......
At the hour of 5:05 PM the jury returned and, by their foreperson, as to Count #1 brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

**Court ordered a PSI with a recommendation.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case adjourned to 03-23-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Ceafus R Chillis in court with attorney James Eric Goldmann.  Defendant Ceafus R Chillis in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury in box at 4:30 PM.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Opening statements by state and defense.

Time is now 4:41 and Court concluded for the day.
Court instructed jurors to return tomorrow, 01-27-2015 at 10:00 AM.
Jury out of box at 4:42 PM.

Defendant Ceafus R Chillis in court with attorney James Eric Goldmann.  Defendant Ceafus R Chillis in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:45 PM.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  
Court instructed the jury.

Jury list received and filed.
filed by ADA Timothy Cotter on behalf of the State.

Final Pretrial Conference held.
Parties remain in a trial posture.
There are no pretrial issues at this time.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 01-26-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Ceafus R Chillis in court IN CUSTODY with attorney James Eric Goldmann.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties are unable to proceed with a Jury Trial today.
State received new discovery recently that discloses a new witness that the State was not aware of and has not subpoenaed.
State requests an adjournment of the trial.
No objections.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 12-19-2014 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 01-26-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Ceafus R Chillis in court with attorney James Eric Goldmann.  Defendant Ceafus R Chillis in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Douglas Williams-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Orville D.; Mark C.; Lamont B.; Kimberly Y.

Defendant Ceafus R Chillis in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Ceafus R Chillis in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
